charges.charge_description: 7:2024(b) FRAUD FOOD STAMP PROGRAM did knowingly acquire and possess food stamps, having a value of $100 or more in a manner not authorized by Chapter 51 of Title 7, United States Code, and the regulations issued pursuant to said chapter, in that defendant did purchase food stamps of a value of $260.00 in exchange for $180.00 cash (3)

7:2024(b) FRAUD FOOD STAMP PROGRAM did knowingly acquire and possess food stamps having a value of $100 or more in a manner not authorized by Chapter 51 of Title 7, United States Code, and the regulations issued pursuant to said chapter, in that defendants did purchase food stamps of a value of $260.00 in exchange for $171.00 cash; 18:2 Aid and Abet (1)

charges.charge_disposition: Defendant is committed to the custody of the U.S. Bureau of Prisons for 6 months, defendant shall surrender for service at institution desginated by the Bureau of Prisons when notified by the Marshal's Service, Supervised release for 3 years, with standard and additiona lconditions 1. The defendant shall pay his court fine within 60 days from the date of his release from confinement 2. The defendant shall make restitution to the U.S. Department of Agriculture in the amount of $169.00 within 30 days of sentencing. Fine $5,000.00 within 60 days from release from confinement, This fine plus any interest required shall be paid, Restitution $169.00, Special Assessment $50.00 immediately (1)

charges.charge_description: 7:2024(b) FRAUD FOOD STAMP PROGRAM did knowingly acquire and possess food stamps having a value of $100 or more in a manner not authorized by Chapter 51 of Title 7, United States Code, and the regulations issued pursuant to said chapter, in that defendants did purchase food stamps of a value of $260.00 in exchange for $171.00 cash; 18:2 Aid and Abet (1)

charges.charge_disposition: Committed to custody of Bureau of Prisons for a term of two (2) months; upon release shall be on supervised release for a term of two (2) years. While on supervised release the defendant shall comply with the standard conditions adopted by this court and the following additional conditions: 1) shall pay the court ordered fine of $1000 at a rate of not less than $100 per month as directed by the Probation Officer; shall make restitution to the U.S. Department of Agriculture in the amount of $189.00 within 30 days. The defendant shall pay a fine of $1000. Further ordered to pay a special assessment of $50-due immediately. The defendant is to report to the designated institution on 1/24/95 as directed by the United States Marshal or by further order of the court. (1)

charges.charge_description: 7:2024(b) FRAUD FOOD STAMP PROGRAM did knowingly acquire and possess food stamps, having a value of $100 or more in a manner not authorized by Chapter 51, Title 7, United States Code, and the regulations issued pursuant to said chapter, in that defendant did purchase food stamps of a value of $230.00 in exchange for $130.00 cash (2)
